contents: 1According to CNN, Hazard made relevant remarks while accepting CNN's "State of the Union" program, which was hosted by Jack Tarper. At the beginning of the show, Tapper pointed out that the number of deaths from the new crown pneumonia in the United States has approached 90,000. Hazard then attributed the cause to the health of the Americans, saying "Unfortunately, the United States has a very diverse population. Severely unhealthy concomitant disease groups, which puts many people in our community, especially African Americans, and minority communities at risk, because these people have potential disease health differences and associated diseases. This is in the American health care system Of course we have to resolve the unfortunate legacy."
